intro: Campanula rotundifolia subsp. cespitosa, commonly known as the round-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of rounded, velvety leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or meadow habitats. It is a perennial species that spreads by rhizomes, forming dense mats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and naturalized areas.
